content:
Sure, here's an updated configuration that includes support for mobile nodes with their own radio nets that connect into the overlay network when in range via RIP.

Overlay Router 1 Configuration:
```kotlin
hostname overlay1
!
interface lo
 ip address 192.168.1.1/32
!
interface ens1f0
 no ip address
!
interface vxlan10
 vxlan id 10
 vxlan local-tunnelip 192.168.100.1
 vxlan remote-tunnelip 192.168.100.2
 vxlan udp-port 4789
 vxlan flood vtep
!
interface vlan100
 ip address 10.0.1.1/24
!
interface vlan200
 ip address 10.0.2.1/24
!
router ospfv3
 router-id 192.168.1.1
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface vlan100
 no passive-interface vlan200
!
router bgp 65001
 bgp router-id 192.168.1.1
 neighbor 192.168.100.2 remote-as 65002
 !
 address-family ipv4 unicast
  neighbor 192.168.100.2 activate
  network 10.0.1.0/24
  network 10.0.2.0/24
 exit-address-family
!
route-map optimize permit 10
 match ip address prefix-list optimize
 set local-preference 200
!
ip prefix-list optimize seq 10 permit 10.0.1.0/24
ip prefix-list optimize seq 20 permit 10.0.2.0/24

router rip
 version 2
 network 192.168.2.0/24
!
```
Overlay Router 2 Configuration:
```kotlin
hostname overlay2
!
interface lo
 ip address 192.168.1.2/32
!
interface ens1f0
 no ip address
!
interface vxlan10
 vxlan id 10
 vxlan local-tunnelip 192.168.100.2
 vxlan remote-tunnelip 192.168.100.1
 vxlan udp-port 4789
 vxlan flood vtep
!
interface vlan100
 ip address 10.0.1.2/24
!
interface vlan200
 ip address 10.0.2.2/24
!
router ospfv3
 router-id 192.168.1.2
 passive-interface default
 no passive-interface vlan100
 no passive-interface vlan200
!
router bgp 65002
 bgp router-id 192.168.1.2
 neighbor 192.168.100.1 remote-as 65001
 !
 address-family ipv4 unicast
  neighbor 192.168.100.1 activate
  network 10.0.1.0/24
  network 10.0.2.0/24
 exit-address-family
!
route-map optimize permit 10
 match ip address prefix-list optimize
 set local-preference 200
!
ip prefix-list optimize seq 10 permit 10.0.1.0/24
ip prefix-list optimize seq 20 permit 10.0.2.0/24

router rip
 version 2
 network 192.168.3.0/24
!
```
In this updated configuration, we have added support for mobile nodes with their own radio networks that connect into the overlay network when in range via RIP. Each overlay router has a RIP process configured to advertise routes to its respective radio network. In this example, Overlay Router 1 has a radio network with the subnet 192.168.2.0
